# f5distributedcloud_dns_lb_pool (Resource)

The `f5distributedcloud_dns_lb_pool` resource manages DNS Load Balancer Pools in F5 Distributed Cloud.

DNS LB Pools define groups of endpoints for DNS-based load balancing with health checking and failover capabilities.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "f5distributedcloud_dns_lb_pool" "example" {
  name      = "my-dns-pool"
  namespace = "my-namespace"

  load_balancing_mode = "round-robin"

  members {
    address  = "10.0.0.1"
    port     = 80
    priority = 1
    ratio    = 1
    enabled  = true
  }

  members {
    address  = "10.0.0.2"
    port     = 80
    priority = 1
    ratio    = 1
    enabled  = true
  }
}
```



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String)
- `namespace` (String)

### Optional

- `description` (String)
- `load_balancing_mode` (String) Load balancing mode for the pool.
- `members` (Block List) Pool members configuration. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--members))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--members"></a>
### Nested Schema for `members`

Required:

- `address` (String) IP address of the pool member.
- `port` (Number) Port number of the pool member.

Optional:

- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the pool member is enabled.
- `priority` (Number) Priority of the pool member.
- `ratio` (Number) Ratio weight for load balancing.
